attributes.action: Make inhalers free on the NHS for asthma sufferers
attributes.additional_details:
Asthma UK states that there are over 5.4 million people with asthma in the UK, which means asthma affects one in every 11 people and one in five households.
For a quarter of a million people with severe asthma, even climbing the stairs can feel like a marathon.
In 2014, 1216 people had died from asthma. That figure is still rising.
People who suffer from diabetes do not have to pay for insulin and diabetes is a long term condition like asthma. 
Sufferers should not have to pay to breathe.
attributes.background: Asthma is a very common respiratory condition causing difficulty in breathing. It can be very dangerous and I have known people that have died from asthma attacks. For people on multiple inhalers it can become very expensive to renew prescriptions for something that can be life saving.
